author: Carry Lifte
title: Atlanta Hawks soar past shorthanded Charlotte Hornets with Trae Young's explosive 31 points and prepare for crucial battles against NBA titans including Stephen Curry
text:
Week in Review
The Atlanta Hawks experienced a mix of results this week. While a loss against Brooklyn highlighted some defensive shortcomings, victories over lower-tier opponents rejuvenated the team’s momentum. The overall performance places them at 17th in the league rankings, emphasizing both the challenges they face and the room for improvement ahead.
Thrilling Victory Against Charlotte
On the road, the Hawks delivered a commanding 134-102 win over a shorthanded Charlotte Hornets team. Trae Young emerged as the standout performer, scoring 31 points and distributing eight assists. His efficiency from beyond the arc—making five of nine attempts—secured his place among the elite players who have achieved 30-point games paired with multiple long-range shots. This win marked the most dominant performance of the season and completed a season sweep against their divisional rival.
Crew Contributions and Defensive Play
The success of the game was underscored by strong contributions from multiple players. Dyson Daniels came close to a triple-double by adding 22 points, seven rebounds, and seven assists to his stat line, while Zaccharie Risacher delivered 21 points, including an explosive third quarter that sparked the Hawks’ offensive surge. The team’s collective shooting efficiency of 54% from the field and 49% from three-point range significantly disrupted the opponent’s rhythm. A disciplined defensive effort forced 17 turnovers, leading to 22 fast-break points, and helped maintain an impressive offensive rating throughout the match.
Looking Ahead
The schedule promises further tests as the Hawks prepare to face formidable teams featuring some of the sport’s most talented figures. With a brief three-day rest period ahead of hosting a high-profile matchup at State Farm Arena, the team is focused and determined. Every game brings them closer to playoff contention as they continue to refine their playmaking and tighten their defensive strategies in challenging encounters.
